intro: Thalictrum caesium, commonly known as the showy avens, is a herbaceous perennial plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Ranunculaceae family, which includes buttercups and crowfoot plants. The plant features slender, upright stems with finely divided, fern-like leaves that give it a delicate appearance. Its flowers are white or pale yellow, with numerous stamens and a central pistil, typically blooming in early summer. Thalictrum caesium thrives in moist, shady environments and is often found in woodlands and stream banks.
